{{Infobox NCAA Basketball Conference Tournament | Year = 2011 | Conference = Pacific-10 Conference | Division = I | Gender = Men's | Image = Pac10 2011 Tournament.png | ImageSize = 126px | Caption = 2011 tournament logo | Teams = | Arena = [[Staples Center]] | City = [[Los Angeles, California]] | Champions = [[Washington Huskies men's basketball|Washington Huskies]] | TitleCount = 3rd | Coach = [[Lorenzo Romar]] | CoachCount = 3rd | MVP = [[Isaiah Thomas (basketball)|Isaiah Thomas]] | MVPTeam = Washington | Attendance = 12,074 | OneTopScorer = * | TwoTopScorers = | TopScorer = [[Klay Thompson]] | TopScorerTeam = Washington State | TopScorer2 = | TopScorer2Team = | Points = 43 | Television = [[CBS Sports|CBS]], [[FSN]] | Different Next = [[2012 Pacific-12 Conference Men's Basketball Tournament|2012]] }} {{2010â11 Pacific-10 Conference men's basketball standings}} The '''2011 [[Pacific Life]] [[Pacific-10 Conference]] [[Pacific-10 Conference Men's Basketball Tournament|Men's Basketball Tournament]]''' was played on March 9â11, 2011 at the [[Staples Center]] in [[Los Angeles]], California.[http://www.pac-10.org/sports/m-baskbl/spec-rel/2009-mbb-tournament.html Pac-10 Tournament official site] The tournament champion became the [[2011 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament|NCAA Tournament]] automatic qualifier from the conference. The [[Arizona Wildcats]], finish the season atop of the conference with a 14â4 record, and the [[UCLA Bruins]] were the two top-seed teams in the tournament. The third-seeded [[2010-11 Washington Huskies men's basketball team|Washington Huskies]] won the tournament. ==Seeds== Teams were seeded by conference record, with a tiebreaker system used to seed teams with identical conference records. {| class="wikitable" |- bgcolor="#efefef" !Seed !School !Conf !Overall !Tiebreaker |- |#1 | Arizona | 14â4 | 25â6 | |- |#2 | UCLA | 13â5 | 22â9 | |- |#3 |Washington | 11â7 | 20â10 | |- |#4 | USC | 10â8 | 18â13 | |- |#5 | California | 10â8 | 17â13 | |- |#6 | Washington State | 9â9 | 19â11 | |- |#7 | Oregon | 7â11 | 14â16 | |- |#8 | Stanford | 7â11 | 15â15 | |- |#9 | Oregon State | 5â13 | 10â19 | |- |#10 | Arizona State | 4â14 | 12â18 | |- |} ==Schedule== {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 95%" |- align="center" !Session !Game !Time* !Matchup# !Television !Attendance |- !colspan=7| First Round â Wednesday, March 9 |- |rowspan=2|

March 12 | RD1-seed1=8 | RD1-team1=Stanford | RD1-score1=67 | RD1-seed2=9 | RD1-team2='''Oregon State''' | RD1-score2='''69''' | RD1-seed3=7 | RD1-team3='''Oregon''' | RD1-score3='''76''' | RD1-seed4=10 | RD1-team4=Arizona State | RD1-score4=69 | RD2-seed1=1 | RD2-team1='''Arizona''' (#16) | RD2-score1='''78''' | RD2-seed2=9 | RD2-team2=Oregon State | RD2-score2=69 | RD2-seed3=4 | RD2-team3='''Southern California''' | RD2-score3='''70''' | RD2-seed4=5 | RD2-team4=California | RD2-score4=56 | RD2-seed5=3 | RD2-team5='''Washington''' | RD2-score5=89 | RD2-seed6=6 | RD2-team6=Washington State | RD2-score6=87 | RD2-seed7=2 | RD2-team7=UCLA | RD2-score7=59 | RD2-seed8=7 | RD2-team8='''Oregon''' | RD2-score8='''76''' | RD3-seed1=1 | RD3-team1='''Arizona''' (#16) | RD3-score1='''67''' | RD3-seed2=4 | RD3-team2=Southern California | RD3-score2=62 | RD3-seed3=3 | RD3-team3='''Washington''' | RD3-score3='''69''' | RD3-seed4=7 | RD3-team4=Oregon | RD3-score4=51 | RD4-seed1=1 | RD4-team1=Arizona (#16) | RD4-score1=75 | RD4-seed2=3 | RD4-team2='''Washington''' | RD4-score2='''77''' }} ==Tournament notes== * Both menâs and womenâs basketball tournament semi-final and final games will be held at the Staples Center. * Coach of the Year Award is renamed to honor Coach [[John Wooden]].[http://www.pac-10.org/News/tabid/863/Article/214943/pac-10-to-honor-wooden-host-combined-mens-and-womens-basketball-tournament.aspx Pac-10 To Honor Wooden, Host Combined Men's And Women's Basketball Tournament], ''Pac-10 News'', October 28, 2010 [[Sean Miller]] of the [[Arizona Wildcats]] is the 2011 winner. * [[Chick Hearn]] Court between Staples Center and [[LA Live]] is closed for the new Pac-10 FanFest, featuring a basketball sport court, beer garden, family-friendly activities like face painting and sign making, a live DJ, band and cheer performances, and Wolfgang Puck food specials. Women's trophy presentation and institutional headquarters are also located at FanFest. * The championship game was the first title game in conference history to require an overtime period.Associated Press, [http://scores.espn.go.com/ncb/recap?gameId=310710012 Isaiah Thomas' fadeaway beats buzzer, crowns Washington as Pac-10 champions], ESPN.com, March 12, 2011 * With the automatic bid to the NCAA tournament, Washington will be making its 16th appearance. ==All-Tournament Team== *[[Jared Cunningham]], Oregon State *[[E.J. Singler]], Oregon *[[Klay Thompson]], Washington State *[[Derrick Williams (basketball)|Derrick Williams]], Arizona *[[Terrence Ross]], Washington *[[Isaiah Thomas (basketball)|Isaiah Thomas]], Washington ==Most Outstanding Player== *[[Isaiah Thomas (basketball)|Isaiah Thomas]], Washington ==2011 Hall of Honor inductees== The induction ceremony will take place on Saturday, March 12 during the Pac-10 Hall of Honor breakfast: * [[Michael Dickerson]] (Arizona) * [[Isaac Austin]] (Arizona State) * [[Bob McKeen]] (California) * Charlie Warren (Oregon) * Charlie White (Oregon State) * [[Brevin Knight]] (Stanford) * [[Don MacLean (basketball)|Don MacLean]] (UCLA) * [[Harold Miner]] (USC) * [[Todd MacCulloch]] (Washington) * Ray Sundquist (Washington State) ==See also== *[[2011 NCAA Men's Division I Basketball Tournament]] *[[Pacific-10 Conference Men's Basketball Tournament]] *[[Template:2010â11 Pacific-10 Conference men's basketball standings|2010â11 Pacific-10 Conference men's basketball standings]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.pac-10.org/Championships/PacificLifePac10BasketballTournament.aspx Pac-10 Basketball Tournament site] {{Pac 10 Tournament}} {{2011 Men's Basketball Conference Tournaments}} [[Category:Pacific-12 Conference Men's Basketball Tournament]] [[Category:2010â11 Pacific-10 Conference men's basketball season|-2010 Pacific-10 Conference Men's Basketball Tournament]]
